TopicTitle: New to KSP, going to Jool!

Articles.Content:
I'm relatively new to KSP and am currently constructing a multiple launch craft to take to Jool including 4 probes and a lander that can hopefully re-dock with the orbiting mother-ship and return home. Its exciting!

I'll post a picture of my craft once I get the final section into orbit and docked.
Sounds great! Im not quite at that stage yet but learning fast! Good luck with your mission!

Nice!

I look forward to seeing the craft; Jool missions are always fun
Haven't been there myself yet! Good luck!

Confession time:

I've been playing since like .16 or something and the farthest manned mission I've ever done was to Minmus. Farthest unmanned mission achieved was to Eve.

So...you're already farther than I've ever gotten...

That sounds fun. My fist interplanetary flight was a trip to Jool, using a tiny ion drive probe, in .18. Needless to say, there were no Kerbals onboard, as the ions were too weak (and it was a secondary payload anyway).

Welcome to the forums!
Welcome and good luck with the mission to Jool!
